CohortCriteria.description: Criteria used for defining the cohort. It is assumed that all cohort participants will match or NOT match such criteria.

ageOfOnset.$comments: If using an ontology class the use of NCIT Age Group ontology term (NCIT:C20587) descendants is recommended.
ageOfOnset.description: Definition of a wrapper for various time descriptors. This follows the Phenopackets structure https://github.com/phenopackets/phenopacket-schema/blob/v2/docs/time-element.rst

oneOf.title: AgeRange

oneOf.description: Gestational age (or menstrual age) is the time elapsed between the first day of the last normal menstrual period and the day of delivery. The first day of the last menstrual period occurs approximately 2 weeks before ovulation and approximately 3 weeks before implantation of the blastocyst. Because most women know when their last period began but not when ovulation occurred, this definition traditionally has been used when estimating the expected date of delivery. In contrast, chronological age (or postnatal age) is the time elapsed after birth. Provenance: Phenopackets v2

days.description: Days beyond the completed weeks, if available.

weeks.description: Completed weeks of gestation according to the above definition.

oneOf.title: GestationalAge

oneOf.description: Time in date-time ISO8601 string format.

end.description: Time in date-time ISO8601 string format.

start.description: Time in date-time ISO8601 string format.

items.description: Ethnic background of the individual. Recommended is the use of a value from NCIT Race (NCIT:C17049) ontology term descendants, e.g. NCIT:C126531 (Latin American). A geographic ancestral origin category that is assigned to a population group based mainly on physical characteristics that are thought to be distinct and inherent. [ NCI ]

evidence.title: Evidence

excluded.description: Flag to indicate whether the phenotypic feature was observed or not. Default is ‘false’, in other words the phenotype was observed. Therefore it is only used in cases where the phenotype was looked for but found to be absent. More formally, this modifier indicates the logical negation of the OntologyClass used in the `featureType` field. CAUTION: It is imperative to check this field for correct interpretation of the phenotype! Source: Phenopackets v2

id.description: A CURIE identifier, e.g. as `id` for an ontology term.

label.description: The text that describes the term. By default it could be the preferred text of the term, but is it acceptable to customize it for a clearer description and understanding of the term in an specific context.

modifiers.description: This subontology is designed to provide terms to characterize and specify the phenotypic abnormalities defined in the Phenotypic abnormality subontology, with respect to severity, laterality, age of onset, and other aspects. Example use here would be one or more terms from HPO Clinical Modifier (HP:0012823). Source: Phenopackets v2

cohortDesign.title: Ontology Term
cohortDesign.description: Cohort type by its design. A plan specification comprised of protocols (which may specify how and what kinds of data will be gathered) that are executed as part of an investigation and is realized during a study design execution. Value from Ontologized MIABIS (OMIABIS) Study design ontology term tree (OBI:0500000).

cohortSize.description: Count of unique Individuals in cohort (individuals meeting criteria for `user-defined` cohorts). If not previously known, it could be calculated by counting the individuals in the cohort.

cohortType.description: Cohort type by its definition. If a cohort is declared `study-defined` or `beacon-defined` criteria are to be entered `in cohort_inclusion_criteria`; if a cohort is declared `user-defined` `cohort_inclusion_criteria` could be automatically populated from the parameters used to perform the query.

start.title: Age

oneOf.title: AgeRange

oneOf.description: Gestational age (or menstrual age) is the time elapsed between the first day of the last normal menstrual period and the day of delivery. The first day of the last menstrual period occurs approximately 2 weeks before ovulation and approximately 3 weeks before implantation of the blastocyst. Because most women know when their last period began but not when ovulation occurred, this definition traditionally has been used when estimating the expected date of delivery. In contrast, chronological age (or postnatal age) is the time elapsed after birth. Provenance: Phenopackets v2

days.description: Days beyond the completed weeks, if available.

weeks.description: Completed weeks of gestation according to the above definition.

oneOf.title: GestationalAge

label.description: The text that describes the term. By default it could be the preferred text of the term, but is it acceptable to customize it for a clearer description and understanding of the term in an specific context.

id.description: Cohort identifier. For `study-defined` or `beacon-defined` cohorts this field is set by the implementer. For `user-defined` this unique identifier could be generated upon the query that defined the cohort, but could be later edited by the user.

inclusionCriteria.description: Inclusion criteria used for defining the cohort. It is assumed that all cohort participants will match such criteria.

ageRange.description: Individual age range in cohort inclusion criteria

end.description: Represents age as an ISO8601 duration (e.g., P59Y).

start.title: Age

ageRange.title: AgeRange

items.description: Diseases diagnosed e.g. to an individual, defined by diseaseID, age of onset, stage, level of severity, outcome and the presence of family history. Similarities to GA4GH Phenopackets v2 `Disease`

label.description: The text that describes the term. By default it could be the preferred text of the term, but is it acceptable to customize it for a clearer description and understanding of the term in an specific context.

familyHistory.description: Boolean indicating determined or self-reported presence of family history of the disease.

notes.description: Unstructured text to describe additional properties of this disease instance.

severity.description: Severity as applicable to phenotype or disease observed. Recommended are values from Human Phenotype Ontology (HP:0012824), e.g `mild`. The intensity or degree of a manifestation. Source: Phenopackets v2

items.title: Disease

items.description: Ethnic background of the individual. Recommended is the use of a value from NCIT Race (NCIT:C17049) ontology term descendants, e.g. NCIT:C126531 (Latin American). A geographic ancestral origin category that is assigned to a population group based mainly on physical characteristics that are thought to be distinct and inherent. [ NCI ]

id.description: A CURIE identifier, e.g. as `id` for an ontology term.

label.description: The text that describes the term. By default it could be the preferred text of the term, but is it acceptable to customize it for a clearer description and understanding of the term in an specific context.

items.title: Ontology Term

items.description: Sex of the individual. Recommended values from NCIT General Qualifier (NCIT:C27993): "unknown" (not assessed or not available) - NCIT:C17998; "female" - NCIT:C16576;  "male" - NCIT:C20197

id.description: A CURIE identifier, e.g. as `id` for an ontology term.

label.description: The text that describes the term. By default it could be the preferred text of the term, but is it acceptable to customize it for a clearer description and understanding of the term in an specific context.

items.title: Ontology Term

locations.description: Geographic location(s) in cohort inclusion criteria

items.description: Country or region of origin of the individual (birthplace or residence place regardless of ethnic origin). Value from GAZ Geographic Location ontology (GAZ:00000448), e.g. GAZ:00002459 (United States of America).

id.description: A CURIE identifier, e.g. as `id` for an ontology term.

label.description: The text that describes the term. By default it could be the preferred text of the term, but is it acceptable to customize it for a clearer description and understanding of the term in an specific context.

items.title: Ontology Term

phenotypicConditions.description: Phenotypic condition(s) in cohort inclusion criteria

items.description: Used to describe a phenotype that characterizes the subject or biosample.

evidence.description: The evidence for an assertion of the observation of a type. RECOMMENDED.

id.description: A CURIE identifier, e.g. as `id` for an ontology term.

label.description: The text that describes the term. By default it could be the preferred text of the term, but is it acceptable to customize it for a clearer description and understanding of the term in an specific context.

example.label: author statement from published clinical study used in manual assertion

reference.description: Representation of the source of the evidence

example.label: Recurrent Erythema Nodosum in a Child with a SHOC2 Gene Mutation

id.description: An application specific identifier. RECOMMENDED.

notes.description: An optional text descriptor. Renamed compared to GA4GH Phenopackets v2 `ExternalReference.description`
notes.example: Signatures of Discriminative Copy Number Aberrations in 31 Cancer Subtypes

reference.title: ExternalReference

evidence.title: Evidence

excluded.description: Flag to indicate whether the phenotypic feature was observed or not. Default is ‘false’, in other words the phenotype was observed. Therefore it is only used in cases where the phenotype was looked for but found to be absent. More formally, this modifier indicates the logical negation of the OntologyClass used in the `featureType` field. CAUTION: It is imperative to check this field for correct interpretation of the phenotype! Source: Phenopackets v2

id.description: A CURIE identifier, e.g. as `id` for an ontology term.

label.description: The text that describes the term. By default it could be the preferred text of the term, but is it acceptable to customize it for a clearer description and understanding of the term in an specific context.

modifiers.description: This subontology is designed to provide terms to characterize and specify the phenotypic abnormalities defined in the Phenotypic abnormality subontology, with respect to severity, laterality, age of onset, and other aspects. Example use here would be one or more terms from HPO Clinical Modifier (HP:0012823). Source: Phenopackets v2

id.description: A CURIE identifier, e.g. as `id` for an ontology term.

label.description: The text that describes the term. By default it could be the preferred text of the term, but is it acceptable to customize it for a clearer description and understanding of the term in an specific context.

notes.description: Unstructured text to describe additional properties of this phenotypic feature.

onset.description: Age or time at which the feature was first observed.
onset.$comments: If using an ontology class the use of NCIT Age Group ontology term (NCIT:C20587) descendants is recommended.
